title: Understanding Our Universe (1st+2nd Ed)(gnv64)
description:
Understanding Our Universe (1st+2nd Ed)
by Stacy Palen and Laura Kay
W. W. Norton & Company | November 2011/September 2014 | ISBN-10: 0393936317/0393912108 | True PDF | 560 pages | 26.9/29.3 mb

Students learn astronomy by doing astronomy.
Influenced by astronomy education research, the Second Edition continues to lead the way by providing pedagogy and a learning package that facilitates learning by doing better than any other intro astronomy book.

About the Authors
Stacy Palen is an award-winning professor in the physics department and the director of the Ott Planetarium at Weber State University.
Laura Kay is an Ann Whitney Olin professor in the Department of Physics and Astronomy at Barnard College, where she has taught since 1991.
Brad Smith is a retired professor of planetary science. He has served as an associate professor of astronomy at New Mexico State University, a professor of planetary sciences and astronomy at the University of Arizona, and as a research astronomer at the University of Hawaii.hy
George Blumenthal is chancellor at the University of CaliforniaÃ¢â‚¬â€œSanta Cruz, where he has been a professor of astronomy and astrophysics since 1972.
